creator: John Craig Freeman
title: 14th & AR, New York City
materials_required: Late model mobile device (iPhone, Android smartphone or iPad) equipped with a camera, GPS, compass, accelerometer, and mobile Internet or Wi–Fi connection
Late model computer with an Internet connection
MySQL database (client version: 5.1.49 or later) running phpMyAdmin (version: 3.3.10.4 or later)
Adobe Photoshop (or equivalent image processing application)
description: This Instructable provides a hands-on introduction to creating geo-located augmented reality experiences using the Layar platform, allowing users to superimpose virtual objects onto the real world at specific GPS coordinates.
steps: Download and install the free Layar Augmented Reality Browser on your mobile device.
Download the Workshop Assets to a folder on your computer and open the AR_Admin.rtf file.
Photograph objects that represent lost things, isolate them in an image processing application with a transparent background, scale to 1024x1024 pixels, and save as .PNG files.
Write short stories for each lost object, relating them to the objects you have chosen.
Install the Layar app and create a Layar account (advanced participants).
Prepare PNG files with transparency at 1024x1024 and 128x128 pixels.
Convert .obj files to Layar's .l3d format using the Layar3D Model Converter, ensuring file sizes remain within specified limits.
Modify .obj files using the Layar3D Model Converter including importing Wavefront files, inspecting stats and replacing images.
Create animated assets using the Layar3D Model Converter including opening Workshop Assets, and enabling animation.
Use photogrammetry techniques to create 3D models from a series of photographs taken at various angles using Autodesk 123D Catch, Autodesk Memento or VisualSfM.
Convert point cloud to poly mesh using MeshLab including removing points, simplification and reconstruction.
Build a database using GoDaddy web hosting and set up a cPanel, MySQL database, and phpMyAdmin.
Configure the web service by compressing the project directory and uploading it to the public_html directory.
Add tables to the database using phpMyAdmin and the provided SQL query.
Modify table fields, including icons, layer settings, object URLs, and POI (Point of Interest) details.
Create and configure a GeoLayar by setting up a Layar Developer account and creating a new layer with appropriate metadata and graphics.
Test the Layar application on your mobile device, using geolocation and loading POIs.

creator: John Craig Freeman
title: 14th & AR, New York City
materials_required: Late model mobile device (iPhone, Android smartphone or iPad) equipped with a camera, GPS, compass, accelerometer, and mobile Internet or Wi–Fi connection
Late model computer with an Internet connection
Web server space and a database (for advanced participants)
Adobe Photoshop (or similar image processing application)
description: This project provides a hands-on introduction to creating geo-located augmented reality experiences using the Layar platform. Participants will learn to create and manage AR assets, place virtual objects at specific locations, and build a database to support their AR applications.
steps: Download and install the free Layar Augmented Reality Browser on your mobile device.
Download the Workshop Assets to a folder on your hard drive and open the AR_Admin.rtf file to document your work.
Photograph objects that represent lost things, isolate them on transparent backgrounds using image editing software, and write short stories about them.
Prepare PNG files with transparency at 1024x1024 and 128x128 pixels.
Convert .obj files to the Layar proprietary .l3d file format using the Layar3D Model Converter.
Modify .obj files using Layar3D Model Converter.
Create animated assets using Layar3D Model Converter.
Create 3D assets using Photogrammetry.
Build a database with GoDaddy or a similar service.
Create a domain name.
Configure the web service.
Add tables to the database using phpMyAdmin.
Modify table fields.
Upload your simple facing plane to cPannel file manager.
Create and Configure a GeoLayar with a Layar Developer Account
